title: Cotijo-Style Estate on 77 Acres in the Andalucían Mountains Heads to Auction
text:
A custom-built estate tucked into the mountains of Andalucía will head to auction next month after spending two years on the market.



The estate, known as Finca La Paz (Peace Farm) is nestled on 77 acres of private land near the small town of Gaucín, about an hour’s drive from Marbella, a resort city on the southern coast. The property is located within the autonomous region of Andalucía, which borders Spain and Portugal.

Bidding will open Nov. 12 at 10 a.m. EST via Concierge Auctions’ website and conclude at a live auction in Hong Kong on Nov. 15. There is no reserve price.



The property was listed on the market for two years asking €5.5 million (US$6.1 million) before its owners decided to sell at auction, according to Cristina Montemayor, public relations manager of Concierge Auctions.



“The sellers’ lifestyle has changed, and they are motivated to sell to the highest bidder for true market value and on their timeline,” Ms. Montemayor said.



More: Second-Home Escapes

The home was built 12 years ago, four years after the owners purchased the land. It was designed as a second family home and private vacation retreat for the owners, who are Austrian and German. They prefer to remain anonymous, Ms. Montemayor said.



The two-story Cortijo-style estate features 48 natural stone pillars flanking a lush central courtyard that is fashioned after the famous Alhambra palace, not far away in Granada. Cortijos are a style of construction similar to a farmhouse that are typically found in rural southern Spain.



Seven bedrooms, six bathrooms, an eat-in kitchen, an office with an adjoining library, and an owner’s private suite make it suitable for both family time and entertaining.

The kitchen cabinetry and the dining room feature solid wood and reclaimed wood finishes. The “warmth and heart of the house come from” the double-sided fireplace between the dining room and the living room, Ms. Montemayor said.



Outside, luxury amenities include a hilltop infinity pool, a pool house with a kitchenette and bathroom, and a private helipad. Gardens and olive trees are surrounded by 37 acres suitable for agricultural use or horse husbandry, according to the listing. The upper hills of the property provide views of Gibraltar and the Rif mountains.
